title: Having issues Patching 7.1? Click Here!
body:
Hey everyone,

The first patch of the 2017 Season is finally here!  It's been a while since we've tinkered with the game, but hopefully it'll give us a chance to smooth out some of the edges.

http://i.imgur.com/uLIffs5.png

We want to make sure to start off the first patch of the new season on the right foot, so if you encounter any issues, check out the solutions below!

--------------------------------------------------------------

#***Updated Client (Beta Client)***

>*** Error: "League of Legends has encountered a problem. Please re-install League alpha client or try again."***

This issue rears its ugly head if something went wrong in either the updating or the installation process of the Client Update. The solution is to complete a full and clean reinstallation of League by following [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) to a T.

>***My IP Balance in the Store is incorrect***

There have been some issues with the client pulling correct IP balances. Some players have been able to resolve this by launching into the Legacy Client and making a single purchase to resolve this. If this does not work, hit us up in a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and we'll work together to resolve this.

--------------------------------------------------------------

#***Legacy Client***

>***Files Scanned reaches over 9000!!!!! Or, 15k, 20k, etc***

The patcher needs to scan already installed files to make sure that none of the files are corrupt.  If it finds one, it replaces it and rescans the files.  This is why it can sometimes get as high as 20k, even though there aren't 20k files in the installation.  

**The best thing to do is let it scan files!**  If you restart the client, it may cause it to scan even more files.   The patcher will eventually stop scanning files, and it will patch normally afterward.

>***Patcher stops/errors out at 33%, Patcher fails at 99%, or a general "Unspecified Error has occurred" message***

These are usually connection related errors. Either your computer is unable to maintain a stable connection, or a 3rd party security program is blocking League of Legends from properly patching. To get these issues resolved ASAP, make sure to go through our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)!

--------------------------------------------------------------

*If after completing these steps, and you still do not see the glorious orange 'LAUNCH' button, feel free to drop us a post in this thread!  Rioters as well as Wrenchmen volunteers will be on hand to respond and provide some additional help!*

Save this, then launch a custom game

I've had some players report that the issues with the new Macbook pro can be resolved by taking the following steps. so I'd love to hear your feedback if these worked for you or not.

**1.** [**Disable the Hot Corners feature**](http://osxdaily.com/2016/08/10/disable-hot-corners-mac/) that comes with macOS. This feature has caused some mouse issues and application freezes for some players on macOS Sierra.

**2.** Since your new Macbook comes with a super high-resolution screen, you may notice some performance issues in-game if your client is still trying to operate with older settings that you used with your older display before you picked up this new Macbook. We'll want to complete a quick reset of your files saved server-side in case this is causing issues for you. First, you'll want to **log into the Client** then you'll want to navigate to your config folder, which should be in this directory:

>**C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config**

Delete these two files:
**- input.ini
- PersistedSettings.json**

Once you've deleted those files, hop into a custom match to check if anything has changed as a result of the steps you've just taken. Please let me know if this helped.

**For Mac users go to:**
Applications> right click the league of legends app icon > click on "show package contents"> "contents" >"LoL"> "Config"

I've just gone to the config file and can only see:
- Folder "Champions"
- game.cfg
- ItemSet.cfg
- PersistedSettings.json

So there is no input.ini in this folder, at least for me. I have hidden files disabled so it is showing everything.

I can try and delete the "PersistedSettings.json" on it's own and test this.

You can actually just delete the entire *Config* folder and it should repopulate everything. Only do this if you don't use item sets, though, as this reset will also clear out any saved item sets you may have.

That's pretty weird. The HRT is simply a local tool that manages and troubleshoots mostly local file issues with League (other than the DNS & Firewall options) so it's very unlikely it directly affected your latency (ping) in-game. What you're seeing is likely impacted by local network settings that just don't work with League. Our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) will walk you through the steps that should resolve this, so I strongly recommend giving them a go.
